website_summaries.verdict: Quality construction on this basic steel fireplace grate that comes in several size options.
pros: Product comes in sizes from 15" to 36" width
Allows for good airflow underneath the wood for nice burning
cons: This grate does not have as many crossbars as other grates, and the coals tend to be a long way from the wood

customer_reviews.title: How to Keep a Fire Going
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice heavy duty fireplace grate. I see some people have complained about the legs being 4 ins. tall and they can't keep a fire going. The solution is to always keep a bed of ashes below the grate , between 1 1/2 to 2 ins. This will allow the embers to be closer to the wood you are burning. I look forward to many years of service from this grate.
customer_reviews.author: ZEB

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had a fireplace for 20 years. I’ve purchased a number of grates over that time they last about a season perhaps two. Then they sag so badly there is no more room under to create draft. These folks eliminated that. Have only burned for half a season so far, no visible sag beyond what they have allotted for. Well made and designed. One year later 7-3-2020 After a full season this grate is as functional as it was on unboxing day. Granted none of the paint is still there, lol. Sturdy, with some slight scaling from many temperature cycles. The picture is from the edit after a year. Very...very satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty Quality
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy and well made. It was exactly as advertised. We have a wood fire going 24/7 and the perfect height for a good fire to get started ... MADE IN THE USA! Bonus. Nothing negative to report.
customer_reviews.author: Martha

customer_reviews.title: Quality product
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product, this is my second buy, but is not reflection on the quality. The first one lasted six years of hard use, one of the cross bars gave up and cracked. I suspect I contributed to this by beating on logs too hard. Will treat this one better and expect it to last for many years.
customer_reviews.author: Donald C. Beatty

customer_reviews.title: Brackets in center for longevity
customer_reviews.text: Update December 2019- yep, still going strong! Update March 2019- still going strong, this grate has not melted or bent and is working fantastic!! Our last fireplace literally ‘melted’ over a three year period. This grate is a bit wider (so fits our fireplace well) and looks much sturdier. First fire was amazing and will update over time.
customer_reviews.author: Lea C

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for our  Extroadinaire 44" Fireplace
customer_reviews.text: The Steel Freak 27" Grate is just the right size for the Extroadinaire 44". Grate is well made with fillet welds across both sides the full width of the 3/8" x 7/8" steel. Bought this unit because it has three extra support legs to prevent the gate from sagging with use. Note: I had to shorten the (7) feet by an 1" as the unit sat a little to high, but I was able to cut them down with a hack saw. It would be nice if the company offered this unit in two different heights. The Extroadroadinaire 44" is a very popular Zero Clearance Insert used in most newer home construction these days.
customer_reviews.author: J. R. Parsons

customer_reviews.title: Nice heavy-duty grate
customer_reviews.text: Our old cast iron grate was falling apart, and this new grate was an excellent choice to replace it. It is very sturdy steel construction, and the airflow is better than our old grate, so our fires are burning better now. I would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Howard M. Harte

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size!
customer_reviews.text: I really struggled over what size grate to get since the fire box is wider in the front then it is in the back. Our fireplace is a custom build so it was hard to know what would be the right grate. The front is 48" and the back is about 27" The 30" turned out to be perfect. So far, 5 star... we'll see how thing go over the next year.
customer_reviews.author: Brian & Stacy

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: Just got this but so far it’s perfect for our fireplace. Nice & heavy not like many of the cheaper ones.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Paint melts off! Stay away!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in Sept and have maybe had 3 fires and the paint melted off and this is what happened.. very poor quality and would have expected it to stand up to a fire if it is a fireplace grate!
customer_reviews.author: Mom2141

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: Bought new grate for wood burning fireplace. Double the weight of my last one for same amount of money. Ordered 24” same as last one. Measure by front legs which is widest point. It tapers to back. Recently purchased so don’t know long term but impressed so far.
customer_reviews.author: dj

customer_reviews.title: Great quality steel and construction
customer_reviews.text: I just received our 2 fireplace grates. It was exactly as pictured. Perfect size for our fireplace. Quality steel, looks really well made. Heavy. We have very hot fires and have burned through many grates. This one looks thicker and stronger than the ones we’ve had. I only gave durability a 4 because we only have had one fire with it. I’ll come back later and let people know how it’s holding up.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Omo

customer_reviews.title: 33 inch grade design
customer_reviews.text: I am using this product in a large outdoor fireplace. The design is very low for holding wood so the logs tend to roll off the grate as it burns. The spacing between the frame is twice as large as my last grate and wood tends to burn and drop between the grates. This causes the wood stacked above to get pushed out of the grate.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very solid and well made
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for use in my outdoor firepit. Very sturdy design and I have no doubt it will get the job done. A good hot fire will burn away the paint, but that's to be expected and not a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Steve R.

customer_reviews.title: Damn that middle leg!
customer_reviews.text: This grate is a poor design. The leg in the center is not only unnecessary, but also makes laying kindling and tending the fire much harder. I wish I had noticed this design flaw before I made this purchase, but I hadn’t lived in a home with a fireplace for 20 years.
customer_reviews.author: Maragret lippman

customer_reviews.title: High Quality Fireplace Grate
customer_reviews.text: I could tell this was a quality grate from the moment we took it out of package. Fit perfect and very sturdy with 8 legs...I think this will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Modciti

customer_reviews.title: Great, solid product.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace a burned one that came with the house we purchased. We have used it for over six months now. We have used it with real wood, coffee logs and various others. I really like it. It holds all the logs in place as needed and fits perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: SusyQ

customer_reviews.title: nice thick and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: the one's i've had in the past always end up melting. these use thick iron and are way better than any other i've used
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Solid fireplace grate.
customer_reviews.text: Solid construction and perfect size for larger fire places. I have absolutely nothing bad to say about this. I burn extremely hot fires and his item holds up great. Must have for beginner to serious burners. I like that the back middle legs are shorter, so it can fit over my ash pit/dump.
customer_reviews.author: G.I. Doe Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Well Made Grate
customer_reviews.text: This is a well made, sturdy fireplace grate. It replaces as old one that I suspect is as old as this house - about 54 years old. I hope this lasts as long ... fingers crossed!
customer_reviews.author: E. Barz

customer_reviews.title: excellent customer service, solidly built grate
customer_reviews.text: Haven't actually had a chance to test drive the grate but previous experience suggests this product will last a lifetime and support the most substantial fire without issue. Looking forward to the first fire after the chimney sweep comes and brings the fireplace up to standard.
customer_reviews.author: D. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Weight
customer_reviews.text: High quality, heavy weight. I use mine in a fire pit outside, works great.
customer_reviews.author: Luca Brasi

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: Very nice fireplace rack. Seems to be holding up well although the winter has just begun. Very nice product.
customer_reviews.author: Lois Greene

customer_reviews.title: So hot!
customer_reviews.text: This is great. Very heavy duty. I do see the issue with holding coals close to wood. I lay some flatter pieces of wood in before starting and it does just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Cord Blumenstock

customer_reviews.title: Well Made
customer_reviews.text: I've only had a few fires to date, so no comment on Durability, however seems well made, and a good value. I contacted the manufacturer giving them my fire box dimensions, and they recommended they proper size, after some of the reviews and Q&A's were hard to follow. They hit it spot on, fits perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: This is it!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve rarely write reviews. This grate is Heavy-Duty. It holds 5-6 logs, max. Burns great. I am thrilled. Durability is great so far. I’ve burned 8-10 nights.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan M

customer_reviews.title: Definitely works
customer_reviews.text: Definitely worth it over cheaper ones. Black coating obviously will burn off but not thin material. And the extra legs in the middle will prevent sagging which is main issue with cheaper ones. Just spend the extra few bucks
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Appears to be durable
customer_reviews.text: The grate is the perfect size for our fireplace. We have only used it for a week but it seems sturdy and hopefully will last many years.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous buyer

customer_reviews.title: Fireplace Grate
customer_reviews.text: The grate arrived on time and as described. Very heavy duty, and generates great airflow for the fire. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: DHH

customer_reviews.title: Nice Grate
customer_reviews.text: The grate is well built, has been performing flawlessly. I did have to trim the middle legs for firebrick clearance, but that was for my heater.
customer_reviews.author: jerry o. waddell

customer_reviews.title: Quality and price
customer_reviews.text: Love this made in America product. It's solid and my fires are fantastic
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my small fireplace
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my small fireplace. Very attractive and heavy. It was a little hard to measure correctly as the description doesn't really tell you where the dimensions are measure from. Measure from leg to leg
customer_reviews.author: Donna Bergmark

customer_reviews.title: Tall
customer_reviews.text: A little too tall for my gas starter, but I cut it down about an inch in each leg. Very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Charles T. Grant

customer_reviews.title: The grate fits my old fireplace just wright. It ...
customer_reviews.text: The grate fits my old fireplace just wright. It allows the fire from the gas jets to burn and start the logs on fire quickly and that is a plus.
customer_reviews.author: lucylou

customer_reviews.title: A very good option
customer_reviews.text: Quite solid. As advertised. I like the design of this and it has been performing well. I wanted something wider and this fits very well.
customer_reviews.author: M Suzuki

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, strong
customer_reviews.text: In trying to decide on a grate, I didn't realize that the height as well as the width and length dimensions are so important. This grate is the perfect height for allowing the air to draw.
customer_reviews.author: Judith E. Luchsinger

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: Seriously!? The outside legs on this 24" grate are over 5 inches! Totally worthless. I hate myself for buying this garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Food Lover

customer_reviews.title: made in the USA
customer_reviews.text: Made in USA, welds are excellent, look forward to many years of using this grate..
customer_reviews.author: john terry

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and looks good
customer_reviews.text: It's been working great for several months now. I am quite happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Bedingfield

customer_reviews.title: Solid product
customer_reviews.text: Tired of having to replace cast iron grates. This seems well made and heavy duty. Hope it lasts. I put hardware cloth in the bed of mine to keep coals and wood from falling between tines while letting air through so fire burns better.
customer_reviews.author: D.W.

customer_reviews.title: Best one yet
customer_reviews.text: If you like a GOOD fire as in large, skip the cheap grates without support "unless you can weld in supports" and go with this. You will not have to replace them. I bought two and have huge fires in a very large outdoor fireplace, they are excellent!!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Fireplace grate is great!
customer_reviews.text: The grate is a few inches bigger than the one used for many years. I like the size. It is sturdy and durable. I am very pleased with it. The fires we have had with it have been warm and inviting. I plan to order a second grate for our other fireplace.
customer_reviews.author: elizabeth hurney

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy support
customer_reviews.text: Thick form and perfectly sized for my small fireplace. The center leg insures my logs are supported letting them burn more evenly. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Amelia Thornton

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: Looks nice and seems sturdy, however the coating starts to flake off quite quickly in the higher heat areas.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Schenkhuizen

customer_reviews.title: Best grate Yet
customer_reviews.text: Works Great--have had several different styles for a standard regular fireplace--best on yet
customer_reviews.author: damguy56

customer_reviews.title: Thin, flimsy and disappointing
customer_reviews.text: After the 3rd fire, it is already beginning to sag and collapse. At this rate, it will not last a month.
customer_reviews.author: Rod Creach

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty fireplace grate
customer_reviews.text: Very well made fireplace grate. Heavy and durable. Made in the USA
customer_reviews.author: T. Copeland

customer_reviews.title: Well made grate.
customer_reviews.text: We haven't used it yet, but the grate was much better made than I had expected for the price. I'm sure it will be "grate" for this winter.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick J. Schouten

customer_reviews.title: Made in USA
customer_reviews.text: American made to burn my american wood in my american brick fireplace. Put this bad boy in my fireplace and the wood burned red white and blue.
customer_reviews.author: ERIK J.

customer_reviews.title: Great grate
customer_reviews.text: Just had our first fire using this grate and it worked, well, great. It feels substantial, like it would be durable, just haven’t used it enough yet to know.
customer_reviews.author: L & J

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Had a different product. When it got hot it melted and bent in the middle
customer_reviews.author: SomeGuy

customer_reviews.title: This is perfect for my small wood burning stove
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for my small wood burning stove! We looked all over for one that would fit but they were all gust a little too long or too wide. We did have to cut the legs down just a little, as it was too tall, but otherwise, it’s just perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice and heavy; seems well made. So far so good; time will tell how well it holds up.
customer_reviews.author: JoeCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Grate too high!
customer_reviews.text: Grate is too high. Logs fall off and between the grate. It takes forever to get a steady fire going because the logs are so far away from the coals. Buy a shorter grate.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Legitimately solid USA product
customer_reviews.text: Solid, great quality. Heavy and also balanced - no wobbling.
customer_reviews.author: Joe M

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty Fireplace Grate
customer_reviews.text: The fireplace grate was heavy duty, made of solid steel material and the price was right!
customer_reviews.author: MGA41373

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement for our old grate. Works well in our fireplace.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Jensen

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: This product is exactly as described. It fits perfectly in my fireplace and although I only burned one log it can actually fit two side by side.
customer_reviews.author: K.G.

customer_reviews.title: Really strong, heavy duty, quality product.
customer_reviews.text: I really like the quality and craftsmanship. The only reason I rated 4 stars on durability is because I would like to use it some to see how it holds up.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Love this grate.
customer_reviews.text: Previously had a cast iron grate that warped and cracked after one yrs use. Worth every penny. This grate has been red hot and is holding up great.
customer_reviews.author: TonHa

customer_reviews.title: Rings to short for front and back
customer_reviews.text: The rings are too short the wood falls off the back and the front.

customer_reviews.title: Fireplace grate
customer_reviews.text: Good product. Would like for it to be a little heavier duty but it’s a good grate especially for the money
customer_reviews.author: David C.

customer_reviews.title: Looks well made. Have not used it yet but ...
customer_reviews.text: Looks well made . Have not used it yet but is an improvement on the sagging worn out grate it replaced. Made in usa which is a plus

customer_reviews.title: A quality product
customer_reviews.text: Well made and with quality material. Head and shoulders above the junk in the big box hardware stores. I expect that the grate wil last a lifetime.

customer_reviews.title: Decent but doesn’t last.
customer_reviews.text: Does not last. 2 years and already has to be replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Steel

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: It came in a timely fashion, very durable, also very heavy which is what we’re looking for, for longevity.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: It seems so much more heavy duty than the cast iron grates and for about the same price. Its also great that its actually made in the USA.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Ann Fallon

customer_reviews.title: 🇺🇸🇺🇸🇺🇸
customer_reviews.text: Liked made in America also keeping jobs hear and middle support legs in case of saging 👍🏻
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Leveque Sr.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: We tried to find a grate locally, but no luck. This was just right!!
customer_reviews.author: B. Garcia

customer_reviews.title: 👍👍 solid
customer_reviews.text: Only used a couple times, but excellent grate. Solid and builds a nice fire with good draft.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: This product is the best constructed grate I have had so far
customer_reviews.text: This product is the best constructed grate I have had so far. I really appreciate the measurements listed in the photo determine the right size for the firebox.

customer_reviews.title: Made in the USA!
customer_reviews.text: By far the best grate I have ever seen. Heavy duty and a perfect fit. Clearly hand made and made in the USA!

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: So far so good have had about 10 or so fires in my outdoor fireplace it is made of heavy steel shouldn’t come apart like my others

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: Just got this. I am very happy with the quality.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: It fits perfect in the fire place but have not had a fire since it was received

customer_reviews.title: Light weight but very sturdy. Simple but practical
customer_reviews.text: arrived in 2 days. Light weight but very sturdy. Simple but practical.. Would buy again.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in a timely fashion. Seems well constructed and made in USA.

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and exactly as described
customer_reviews.text: Excellwnt all the way around! Great quality and exactly as described.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: As described - Lets see how it holds up to a few fires!!
customer_reviews.author: William Littlestone

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product, heavy duty. Just what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.author: Bmak

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: Holds a good amount of wood and the height allows the oxygen to flow. Some of my wood pieces are small is I am adding an ember retainer. I’ve only used it a couple of times but it feels heavy duty and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Jo

customer_reviews.title: The overall height was a little deceptive because it was ...
customer_reviews.text: The overall height was a little deceptive because it was measured from the top of the curled cross pieces not the wood platform.
customer_reviews.author: BDH

customer_reviews.title: ... but I can see that it will work much better than the one it replaced
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had a chance to use it yet but I can see that it will work much better than the one it replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Bernice W.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect to hold my logs
customer_reviews.text: I had previous grates bought from my local home improvement chain store, and the metal bars when heated in the hot flame became bowed as to where large gaps developed in the grate. This led to the logs falling in between the grates. This grate is strong, very solid, does not at all change shape in the high heat and also is long enough to fit my whole fire place without any spaces on each end. Its really a perfectly made grate for those of us who enjoy wood burning fire places.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: Last fall we bought a house with a wood burning fireplace, something both of us were excited to use because we had never had one before. However, we discovered that the fireplace grate that the previous owners left was grossly misshapen and brittle to the point of breaking. Cue this purchase. This grate has now seen 6 fires and looks essentially like new. No warping or breakdown of the metal at all. I would fully recommend this grate.
customer_reviews.author: S. Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t sag with hot fires like my previous others
customer_reviews.text: Well designed. Doesn’t sag with hot fires like my previous others. Unit a little high off fireplace floor when ashes are cleaned out. Bed of coals is what keeps fire going. Takes a good 6 hours of burning to get coal bed high enough to burn correctly. Recommend leaving 2” of ashes under grate.
customer_reviews.author: Dana Wilcha

customer_reviews.title: ... of the materials and construction of the product are excellent. The fireplace grate is made of a high ...
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the materials and construction of the product are excellent. The fireplace grate is made of a high quality (heavy) steel, and all of the welded joints are solid. The dimensions were consistent with the dimensions noted in the product description so it fit perfectly within our fireplace opening. The legs are the appropriate height to allow air circulation to the fire.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Long Lasting Grate!
customer_reviews.text: I was compelled to write this review after using this grate for a full year. I bought this after getting tired of having to replace the cheap grates from the hardware stores sometimes twice in a season. We use this in our outdoor fireplace and love using it. We have already gone through 2 cords of wood in this year and it is still holding strong! Well done! Do not hesitate to buy this!
customer_reviews.author: Christian

customer_reviews.title: Strong, heavy duty fire grate.
customer_reviews.text: The bars are further apart than I thought, however, they are solid. We cook over our hearth fire with hardwood. The struts across our last cast iron fire grate finally burned away after many years of user. This should last.
customer_reviews.author: PatienceNeeded

customer_reviews.title: Fits perfectly and is nice and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Really researched before deciding on this fireplace grate. I have a medium to small-ish wood burning stove and the one that came with the house I bought was completely melted through. Just love this one. It fit perfectly, is very sturdy and the price was reasonable. For this I give it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: startupnow

customer_reviews.title: Very very poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item (18 inch) beginning of this back in August 2018 for my fireplace. Unfortunately the legs bent and it is not in the same shape and not usable. I dont recommend this product to anyone. You can use this item as a accessory without fire contacted.... Shortly I will post the picture once I find it in the house.
customer_reviews.author: Huseyin Akkaya

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty, Thick Material, Well Made!
customer_reviews.text: I had a chimney sweep out and he gave us a quote of $180 for a new grate and warned me about the big box stores selling cheap imported grates. I was really happy to find this produce Made in USA for a great price and then when it arrived, I was even happier. This is a really well made product and I expect it to last a long time. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Brown

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit for my fireplace
customer_reviews.text: We just bought a new home that did not have a grate in the fireplace. We were making fires directly on the ground. This is so much better. It creates great airflow for roaring and beautiful fires, and seems to be holding up well so far. It also fit great!
customer_reviews.author: Miss Priss

customer_reviews.title: Large masonry fireplaces need upgraded models like this because the cheaper cast iron will not hold ...
customer_reviews.text: Large masonry fireplaces need upgraded models like this because the cheaper cast iron will not hold up due to higher heat generated by more wood.The cast iron ones will eventually bend under the weight and the heat produced due to the larger firebox.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Orand

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't like high heat
customer_reviews.text: Not as heavy duty as I thought it would be. We use the fireplce every night in cool weather. Center bars began to droop asnd bend from the heat. Bought because it was made in the USA.
customer_reviews.author: Mike E.

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty
customer_reviews.text: We have only used the grate a couple of times, but keeps the wood in fireplace better than previous grates we have used. It appears to be very sturdy, and well made. Hopefully, it will last many years. We have had issues with grates melting over time.
customer_reviews.author: Terri Land

customer_reviews.title: Rock Solid
customer_reviews.text: I burn well-dried eucalyptus, which burns very hot and has deformed other grates. Not so with this Heritage grate. The grate has held up perfectly with two years of use. I highly recommend this grate.
customer_reviews.author: C Deane

customer_reviews.title: This is a great deal for a fireplace grate
customer_reviews.text: This is a great deal for a fireplace grate. I have a stove insert and used it in the wood burning stove.
customer_reviews.author: FWH

customer_reviews.title: Heritage fire grate
customer_reviews.text: Made in USA and it works! What more could you want for the price?!
customer_reviews.author: John P. Butler

customer_reviews.title: Perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Very solid. 33” wide fits my fireplace perfectly. I like the extra height too. Works very well.
customer_reviews.author: DanR

product_meta.title: SteelFreak Heavy Duty Steel Fireplace Grate - Made in The USA (15-Inch)
product_meta.description: Size:15 InchThese steel grates are built from heavy duty 3/8 x 1 inch thick solid bar steel for added durability. Stove and fireplace grates lift firewood up off the bottom of the stove to improve airflow to the fire. These grates are tapered to fit most fireplaces. Their all-steel construction is designed to outperform their low quality cast-iron counterparts. All sizes feature center support legs which are slightly shorter than the outer legs to prevent rocking in the middle while also stopping the grate from sagging over time. Proudly Made in the USA.
feature_bullets: Tapered shape is perfect for most fireplaces
Unique shorter center support legs prevent both rocking and sagging
SteelFreak (formerly Heritage Products) grates are Proudly Made in the USA

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars286 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
